analysis.summary: The customer's request for a refund due to a defective motor is approved, pending confirmation of the defect, as the motor failure falls under the 2-Year Motor Warranty and the Defective Item Override Policy.

policy.reason: The purchase was made 6 weeks ago, which is outside the 30-day standard return window.
This policy applies to process the refund once approved by another policy.
The issue is a motor malfunction, not shipping damage.
There is no indication that the product is under recall.
The motor stopped working, indicating a potential defect, which overrides the standard return window if confirmed.
The motor failed within approximately 6 weeks of purchase, which is within the 2-year motor warranty period.
The issue is with the motor, not the frame of the treadmill.

conflict.description: The General Return Policy (RET-1.1) would deny the return due to being outside the 30-day window, while the Pro-Treadmill X500 Motor Warranty (WAR-3.1) and the Defective Item Override Policy (DEF-4.1) would approve a resolution due to a product defect.

resolution.rule_applied: The Defective Item Override Policy (DEF-4.1) takes precedence as it is a situational override (policy_layer 4), which is the highest policy layer.

analysis.recommended_action: Arrange for the Pro-Treadmill X500 to be inspected by Apex Gear's quality team to confirm the motor defect. Upon confirmation, process a full refund for the customer as requested, or offer a replacement.
